benchmark_details.name: Moderating Harm: Benchmarking Large Language Models for Cyberbullying Detection in YouTube
benchmark_details.overview: This study benchmarks three state-of-the-art large language models on a corpus of 5,080 YouTube comments drawn from high-abuse videos in various domains, to detect cyberbullying and harassment.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To compare the performance of advanced large language models in detecting cyberbullying within real YouTube comments.

data.annotation: Manually annotated by reviewers using a binary rubric for harmful and non-harmful comments.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on true positives, true negatives, false positives, and false negatives of model predictions compared to ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Precision and recall provide insights into the model's effectiveness in detecting harmful comments, with an F1 Score balancing the two.
methodology.baseline_results: Benchmarks include macro-F1 scores from previous models like BERT-base fine-tuned on HateXplain.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All user identifiers and personally identifiable details were removed or replaced with placeholders to mitigate re-identification risk.
